newsitem.title: BOSNIA: One French soldier killed, two injured in Bosnia.
newsitem.headline: One French soldier killed, two injured in Bosnia.

text.p: One French soldier serving with NATO-led peace force in Bosnia was killed and two others injured on Tuesday in a road accident on a mountain near Sarajevo, a NATO spokesman said.
Major Brett Boudreau said the French soldiers' vehicle skidded off the road and fell into a ravine 40 metres (130 ft) deep on Mount Trebevic, overlooking the Bosnian capital from the south.
The two injured soldiers were immediately taken to a military hospital, he said.
No other details were immediately available about the accident.
The 58,000-strong NATO-led force in Bosnia is charged with policing the military part of the Dayton peace agreement which ended four years of war in former Yugoslavia.
